Name: Level1
Instructions: Hi! I need to get the bad piggie! Stack a couple of "move forward" blocks together and press "Run Program" to help me get there.

Name: Level2
Instructions: Write me another program so I can make it all the way to the pig.

Name: Level3
Instructions: How should I get to the pig? (Watch out for TNT)

Name: Level4
Instructions: Argh! Write me a program that gets me past the obstacles and to the pig.

Name: Level5
Instructions: There's a way I can get to the pig using only 2 blocks. Can you figure it out?

Name: Level6
Instructions: Try to get me to the pig using only three blocks.

Name: Level7
Instructions: Write me a program so I can get to the pig using the fewest number of blocks. Try using more than one "repeat times" block.

Name: Level8
Instructions: Use a couple of "repeat times" blocks to get me to the pig!

Name: Level9
Instructions: Ok, try the new "repeat until" block - it will repeat until I reach the pig.

Name: Level10
Instructions: Ok, one last time for practice - can you get me to the pig in only 3 blocks?

Name: Level11
Instructions: Hello.  Me zombie. Me hungry. Must... get... to sunflower... Can you get me there with only 5 blocks?

Name: Leve12
Instructions: Ok, this is similar, but slightly different. Can you do it in only 5 blocks?

Name: Level13
Instructions: Use the new "if" block to let me decide when to turn. Hint: you only need one more block, but learn how we set it up so you can do it on your own next time.

Name: Level14
Instructions: Ok, this is just like the last level, but you need to remember how you used the "if" block and the "repeat" block together.

Name: Level15
Instructions: Me want sunflower! Use an "if" block to get me there with the fewest number of blocks.

Name: Level16
Instructions: Ok, let's do that again for practice - this isn't very different, but watch out for the chompers!

Name: Level17
Instructions: The "If-else" blocks checks a condition, and then does one thing OR another. To get me to the sunflower try to use this new block.

Name: Level18
Instructions: One more practice of the "if-else" block, can you get it right on your first try?

Name: Level19
Instructions: Can you add just 3 blocks to help me solve a more complex maze? If you do it right, I can walk any curvy path no matter the length.

Name: Level1
Instructions: Hi, I'm an artist. You can write code to make me draw almost anything. Use a few blocks to make me draw over the gray lines in the picture.

Name: Level2
Instructions: Now, draw a square. NOTE: use multiple different colors using the new "set color" block.

Name: Level3
Instructions: Make a square using only 3 blocks.  (Blocks to set color are free, so use them if you want)

Name: Level4
Instructions: Draw a triangle whose sides are all in different colors, using the "random color" option that picks a different color each time. Hint: You'll have to figure out how far to turn.

Name: Level5
Instructions: Now, for practice, draw a triangle and then a square to draw an envelope.

Name: Level6
Instructions: Can you figure out how draw this triangle and square? Hint: Do the triangle first, then figure out how much to turn before drawing the square.

Name: Level7
Instructions: Ok, let's make it a bit harder - see if you can draw these green glasses. The squares are 100 dots on each side, and they're 50 dots apart. Don't forget to draw in green!

Name: Level8
Instructions: Ok, try to figure out what happens if you run this code (or press "Run" to try it). Then, repeat it enough times to complete the drawing. The colors will be different every time.

Name: Level9
Instructions: Can you figure out what number to replace the question marks with to draw a circle?

Name: Level10
Instructions: You made it! Now, draw anything you want. Some fun ideas: a stick figure, snowflake, or spiral.  Also try the new "set width" block.  Have fun!

Name: Level1
Instructions: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the house you made with tangram pieces?

Name: Level1
Instructions: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the square you made with two triangles?

Name: Level1
Instructions: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the arrow you made with tangram pieces?

Name: Level1
Instructions: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the ship you made with tangram pieces?

Name: Level1
Instructions: Hi, I'm a farmer. I need your help to flatten the field on my farm so it's ready for planting. Move me to the pile of dirt and use the "remove" block to remove it.

Name: Level2
Instructions: Next, move me to the hole and fill it with TWO shovelfuls of dirt, using the "fill" block.

Name: Level3
Instructions: Move me to the pile of dirt and tell me how many shovelfuls to remove using as few blocks as possible.

Name: Level4
Instructions: Can you help me remove all four piles of dirt? Hint: use a repeat block if you can

Name: Level5
Instructions: Help me fill in all these holes with 5 shovelfuls of dirt. Hint: you can put a "repeat" block inside the "while" block.

Name: Level6
Instructions: Remove all the piles of dirt, using as few blocks as possible. The new options in the dropdown menu on the "while" block tell me if I'm standing on a pile or a hole

Name: Level7
Instructions: Wow, I found a really deep hole! I don't know how many shovelfuls of dirt it needs. Can you write a program that fills it until it's even?

Name: Level8
Instructions: Help me fill in the hole at the end of the field, using as few blocks as possible.

Name: Level9
Instructions: Make me remove all these piles of dirt. Try to use as few blocks as possible. Hint: you can use a "while" block inside a "repeat" block.

Name: Level10
Instructions: I'm working late, so it's dark out, and I can't tell how large the piles are. Now I don't have all the options I used to have on the while block. Move me along the field, and if there is a pile, remove it.

Name: Level11
Instructions: It's still dark outside. Move me along the field. If there is a pile, remove it, and if there is a hole, fill it in. Hint: use the dropdown menu of options on the "if" block.

Name: Level1
Instructions: Hello. Me zombie artist. Me love drawing! Help me draw a square in a special color. Important note: you have all the same blocks but they've now been arranged in categories.

Name: Level2
Instructions: Welcome to using functions! Try the new "draw a square" block, found in the "Functions" category, to draw a small 50x50 green square.

Name: Level3
Instructions: Use the "repeat" block (in the "Loops" category) to draw 3 squares of size 100, each 120 degrees apart. And do it in 3 different, random colors.

Name: Level4
Instructions: Now we're going to get fancy. Change the code to draw 36 squares, 100 dots wide, and each 10 degrees apart. Hint: you may want to use the slider to make me go faster.

Name: Level5
Instructions: Draw squares with sides of 50, 60, 70, 80, and 90 dots.  You'll need to use the "draw a square" function five times.

Name: Level6
Instructions: Ok, this program will use a counter, to draw the same squares as last time. You want the square to be the same size as the counter, so use the "counter" block. Hint: It's in the Variables category.

Name: Level7
Instructions: Here's a program to draw a spiral, but the blocks are disabled so they won't run. Make a new program using a "count with" block (in the Loops category) and "counter" block (in the Variables category) to draw the same spiral.

Name: Level8
Instructions: This one's a bit tricky. There's a new "draw a snowman" function (in the Functions category), and a "jump forward" block (in the Actions category). Draw 3 snowmen in different colors, 100 dots apart.

Name: Level9
Instructions: Use a "count with" loop to draw a family of snowmen with heights of 110, 100, 90, 80, and 70. The snowmen should all be 60 dots apart.

Name: Level10
Instructions: here's some code to try experimenting with different spirals.  What happens if you change the turn amount? Or set a random color in the loop?  Draw anything you like.

Name: Level1
Instructions: Try using the blocks to help me remove all the piles and fill in all the holes on the ground. Try to use loops instead of using too many blocks. Hint: You can put a loop inside another loop.

Name: Level2
Instructions: We've defined our own block called "fill 5", which is now in the Functions category. Use it to help me fill in this hole.

Name: Level3
Instructions: Use the new "fill 5" function block to make me fill in all the holes.

Name: Level4
Instructions: Define a new function that removes 7 shovelfuls. Then use it to write a program that helps me remove all the piles.

Name: Level5
Instructions: Create a new function that removes 6 shovelfuls from a pile, and use it to help me level out all the piles.

Name: Level6
Instructions: Use two new functions, "fill 8" and "remove 8", to help me level out the pile and fill in the hole.

Name: Level7
Instructions: There's a cow in my field! Write a new function that helps me avoid the cow and remove the pile. Put all your blocks inside the new function.

Name: Level8
Instructions: Use this new function, "avoid the cow and remove 1", to help me remove all the piles.

Name: Level9
Instructions: Ok, here's a function that removes 4 different piles of dirt in a vertical column. Try putting this function inside a loop, so that you remove all the piles of dirt using only a few new blocks.

Name: Level10
Instructions: Move me across the field, and use these two functions to help me remove all the piles and fill all the holes.

Name: Level1
Instructions: This level shows you how the "draw a square" and "draw a circle" functions are defined.  Defining a function doesn't run its blocks.  You have to pull out the "draw a square" block to actually draw a square.

Name: Level2
Instructions: Using the "draw a square" function as an example, create a "draw a triangle" function and use it.

Name: Level3
Instructions: Draw triangular fences around the cats and a square fence around the cow.  Tip: Test the program as you go along.

Name: Level4
Instructions: See if you can figure out how to use "draw a square" and "draw a triangle" (and some other blocks) to draw a house around the lion.

Name: Level5
Instructions: Now create a new "draw a house" function and use it to house two cats. Hint: create a new function using the "do something" block, and type your own text to name the block.

Name: Level6
Instructions: Using "draw a square" as an example, add an input named "length" to "draw a triangle". Then, draw triangles in different sizes.  (Hint: click the star to add an input to a function)

Name: Level7
Instructions: Add an input named "height" to "draw a house" and build a big house for the elephant (with edges 150 dots long)

Name: Level8
Instructions: Here are all of the blocks from the previous level.  Modify "draw a house" so I end up at the bottom right corner after drawing a new house.  Use this modified function to draw three houses.

Name: Level9
Instructions: Can you re-create the &quot:draw a house" function without help? Try it, and then draw a row of houses.

Name: Level10
Instructions: You've learned a lot! Now use it to draw whatever you want.  Try to draw a star, or a spiral, or a fancy snowflake.

Name: Level1
Instructions: Welcome to debugging! My code doesn't work right. Can you spot the problem and fix it so that I can get my field flat and ready for planting?

Name: Level2
Instructions: What's wrong with this program? How should you fix it so I can remove that pile?

Name: Level3
Instructions: De-bug this program for me so my field will be nice and flat.

Name: Level4
Instructions: How should you change this program to help me fill the hole?

Name: Level5
Instructions: Help! Fix the program so my field will be completely flat.

Name: Level6
Instructions: De-bug this program so I can fill in the holes and remove all the piles.

Name: Level7
Instructions: What should you change about this program to help me remove all the piles?

Name: Level8
Instructions: Can you de-bug this program for me so I can make my field flat?

Name: Level9
Instructions: Edit this program so I'll remove all the piles on my field.

Name: Level1
Instructions: Take this time to draw whatever you feel like!
